title: [Large-Scale] Clinical Knowledge and Social Responsibility-Based Practical Competency Assessment Course for Hospital Pharmacists

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational pharmaceutical knowledge, basic patient care concepts, understanding of medical ethics and patient rights, basic structure of healthcare systems
context.additional_context: Learners role-playing pre-service/in-service teachers acquire methods to evaluate clinical competencies of hospital pharmacists in PBL-based simulations. Develop assessment frameworks considering medical workplace social dynamics (doctor-pharmacist-nurse collaboration) and public health system integration.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze patient cases related to various body systems to make clinical decisions and exercise socially responsible judgment considering medical ethics and patient rights
Learners can enhance their ability to interpret data for establishing medication use assessment and monitoring plans and propose measures aligned with healthcare systems and patient safety protocols
Learners can propose patient-tailored treatment plans through evidence-based clinical evaluations and explore ways to contribute to community health promotion and public healthcare system improvement
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
